description: There's only been an increase in diagnoses of autism, caused by heightened awareness of the ailment, not incidence.

myth: The Left and right brains have different capabilities
description: No solid functional division; some functions activate some areas more than others. Left brain can learn 'right brain' functions and vice-versa.

myth: Adding salt to water makes it boil more quickly
description: Naturally salted water will boil more quickly, because of the low heat capacity of the salt content but adding salt to fresh water will not make any difference.
Does not prevent sticking. But it can stop the water foaming or boiling over.

myth: Dropping a penny from a tall building could kill someone

myth: Flushed water rotates the otherway in the Southern Hemisphere
description: The Coriolis effect,  induced by the Earth's rotation, does not affect the small amounts of water in toilets, bathtubs.

myth: There is no gravity on the International Space Station
description: Gravity is everywhere. Earth's gravity is pretty strong on the ISS - NASA says a person who weighs 100lb on earth still weighs 90lb there.
